28#include <sys/param.h>
29#include <sys/string.h>
30
31#define IS_DIGIT(c) ((c) >= '0' && (c) <= '9')
32
33#define IS_ALPHA(c) \
34 (((c) >= 'a' && (c) <= 'z') || ((c) >= 'A' && (c) <= 'Z'))
35
36#ifndef __NetBSD__
37char *
38strpbrk(const char *s, const char *b)
39{
40 const char *p;
41
42 do {
43 for (p = b; *p != '\0' && *p != *s; ++p)
44 ;
45 if (*p != '\0')
46 return ((char *)s);
47 } while (*s++);
48
49 return (NULL);
50}
51#endif
52
53/*
54 * Convert a string into a valid C identifier by replacing invalid
55 * characters with '_'. Also makes sure the string is nul-terminated
56 * and takes up at most n bytes.
57 */
58void
59strident_canon(char *s, size_t n)
60{
61 char c;
62 char *end = s + n - 1;
63
64 if ((c = *s) == 0)
65 return;
66
67 if (!IS_ALPHA(c) && c != '_')
68 *s = '_';
69
70 while (s < end && ((c = *(++s)) != 0)) {
71 if (!IS_ALPHA(c) && !IS_DIGIT(c) && c != '_')
72 *s = '_';
73 }
74 *s = 0;
75}
76
77/*
78 * Simple-minded conversion of a long into a null-terminated character
79 * string. Caller must ensure there's enough space to hold the result.
80 */
81void
82numtos(unsigned long num, char *s)
83{
84 char prbuf[40];
85
86 char *cp = prbuf;
87
88 do {
89 *cp++ = "0123456789"[num % 10];
90 num /= 10;
91 } while (num);
92
93 do {
94 *s++ = *--cp;
95 } while (cp > prbuf);
96 *s = '\0';
97}
